Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially purple/black in section, the interior is slightly grooved and bears the remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393365) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393365)
